newsitem.title: USA: CA says results reflect strong core business.
newsitem.headline: CA says results reflect strong core business.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc Tuesday said third quarter results reflected strong demand for the firm's software and noted that core business fundamentals remained strong.
"Our third quarter results reflect continued strong demand for CA software, particularly Unicenter," said CA President Sanjay Kumar.

CA Chairman and chief executivce Charles Wang said, "Our core business fundamentals remain strong, and we are solidly positioned to capitalize on evolving global software market opportunities. With Cheyenne now part of the CA family, we are even better positioned to meet growing client demand."

The company said third quarter December 31, 1996, revenue was $1.05 billion, up 5 percent from the previous year's third quarter. Net income, excluding the previously announced $598 million charge associated with the acquisition of Cheyenne Software, was $284.7 million, up 25 percent over last year.
Third quarter income per share increased 25 percent, to $0.75, excluding the acquisition charge, compared to $0.60 a year ago.
